""We are seeking a meticulous and detail-oriented individual fluent in Indonesian to join our team as a Proofreader. As a Proofreader, you will be responsible for meticulously reviewing and correcting spelling, grammar, punctuation, and formatting errors in written content, ensuring it meets our company's quality standards and client expectations. The ideal candidate will have a keen eye for detail, a deep understanding of Indonesian language conventions, and a passion for maintaining linguistic accuracy.Responsibilities:- Review written content in Indonesian, including articles, documents, marketing materials, and translations, to identify and correct errors in spelling, grammar, punctuation, and formatting.- Ensure consistency and clarity in language usage, adhering to company style guidelines and client preferences.- Verify factual accuracy and coherence of content, making suggestions for improvements as needed.- Collaborate with writers, editors, and translators to maintain consistency in language quality across projects.- Stay updated on language trends and developments to ensureHourly Range: $13.00-$25.00Posted On: February 20, 2024 12:00 UTCCategory: ProofreadingSkills:Indonesian, English to Indonesian Translation, Bhasa, Proofreading, Translation, EnglishSkills: Indonesian, English to Indonesian Translation, Bhasa, Proofreading, Translation, EnglishCountry: Canada""

Improve this resume bullet:
""Hey! We're a brand new marketing agency that has seen some pretty substantial growth over the past 6 months.Now that we've got a core list of our clients, we're looking to bolster our own 'phase 2' of marketing which will include a rebrand, and our creative hoax campaigns.We look to complete all of these projects from March for 3-6months+ and we're looking to leverage our new phase of growth with a brilliant PR Specialist to support us.Our main objective is brand visibility and credibility raising in the 'creative marketing' space. We want to be known for our creativity and as such build our company and 2 director profiles with award entries, speaking and opinion pieces both locally and within trade press.We're going to be up for what you suggest once we set a plan, and we're looking to work on a retainer model for this.Our approach will be monthly, so we'd like if you could set out a top level view of how you could help us - what a budget might look like for working for you, and what we would look to get in return, hours/days etc.We envision this would be kicking off from March time once we get our rebrand nailed (27th of February) and we'd then like to ramp up our activity initially but go harder from April onwards.For us someone who has worked within this space is pretty important, someone we can trust and gives us visibility and someone who is going to push us to be creative as well.Posted On: February 20, 2024 11:59 UTCCategory: Public RelationsSkills:Community Relations, Content Writing, Sales & Marketing, Business with 1-9 Employees, Public Relations, Media Relations, Press ReleaseSkills: Community Relations, Content Writing, Sales & Marketing, Business with 1-9 Employees, Public Relations, Media Relations, Press ReleaseLocation Requirement: Only freelancers located in the United Kingdom may apply.Country: United Kingdom""

Your honest behavior is most important.You will need to perform heart rate measurements with your smartphone’s camera using our application to help us improve our technology and to better understand the user's experience.The task is simple. We will schedule a 45-minute Zoom video call with you to record how you interact with our smartphone application and ask a couple of simple follow-up questions about your experience. For this task, you will need to have an iPhone 11 or newer, a device where you can have video calls, and your honest feedback. Important to note that we must use Zoom for the video recording. So you will need to have a device ( another smartphone, laptop, desktop, tablet, ect) where a video call can take place and your smartphone where you will be doing the testing is visible.We will provide you with detailed instructions upon approval of the job via email.—-------------------Requirements:- iOS Device (iPhone 11 and up)- 50+ years old (can be your relative or family member)- Active interest in monitoring your heart using a smartphone but not required.-THE USER MUST BE AN AVERAGE ENGLISH SPEAKER or can understand basic English and must be able to go through the test/exercise ALONE and be able to understand and answer questions.- If you have read the instructions carefully, write drivingmissmaisy in your proposal-—-------------------This job pays 15$ only for using an app.The goal is to test our technology with users 50+ years old and above, which is our intended population and our target group.If you are interested and you have a relative or parents 50+ years old and have a basic level of English, no experience is needed. Feel free to apply.Hourly Range: $15.00Posted On: February 20, 2024 11:58 UTCCategory: Mobile App DevelopmentSkills:Smartphone, iOSSkills: Smartphone, iOSCountry: Netherlands""

Improve this resume bullet:
""To effectively move your landing page from GoDaddy to SiteGround, follow these steps:Backup Your Landing Page: Before initiating any transfer, ensure you have a backup of your landing page files and database to prevent data loss.Access Your GoDaddy Account: Log in to your GoDaddy account and locate your domain settings. You'll need to update the domain's DNS settings to point to SiteGround's servers.Retrieve SiteGround Nameservers: Log in to your SiteGround account and navigate to the domain management section. Take note of the nameservers provided by SiteGround.Update Nameservers on GoDaddy: In your GoDaddy account, find the domain associated with your landing page and update the nameservers to the ones provided by SiteGround. This change may take some time to propagate across the internet.Transfer Landing Page Files: Using FTP or File Manager in cPanel, transfer your landing page files from your GoDaddy hosting to your SiteGround hosting account. Make sure to replicate the directory structure and permissions as needed.Import Database (If Applicable): If your landing page relies on a database, export the database from GoDaddy's hosting control panel and import it into your SiteGround hosting account. Update any configuration files to point to the new database location if necessary.Update Configuration Settings: Update any configuration settings within your landing page files to reflect the new hosting environment, including database connection details and file paths.Test Your Landing Page: Once the migration is complete, thoroughly test your landing page on SiteGround to ensure all functionalities are working correctly.Update DNS Records (Optional): If your landing page utilizes specific DNS records (e.g., MX records for email), make sure to update them in your SiteGround account accordingly.Monitor for Propagation: Keep an eye on your domain's DNS propagation status to ensure the changes have fully taken effect. This process can take up to 24-48 hours to complete.Cancel GoDaddy Hosting (If Desired): Once you've confirmed that your landing page is successfully hosted on SiteGround and all necessary data has been migrated, you can cancel your hosting subscription with GoDaddy if you no longer wish to use their services.Budget: $20Posted On: February 22, 2024 17:32 UTCCategory: Web DesignSkills:GoDaddy, WordPressSkills: GoDaddy, WordPressCountry: United Kingdom""

""Hi ThereI am looking for a Photoshop Expert who can help Composit product photos into a background. I will provide the high-resolution background and the product photo, your job will be to composite. I have attached a sample picture and the background photo so you get the idea.Only apply if you are an expert and have complete knowledge of lighting, shadows, highlights, and realistic composites.IMPORTANT: PLEASE READ BELOW CAREFULLY.My Minimum Expectations for Photo Compositing:Initial Preparation:Start by ensuring the product image and the new background share similar lighting conditions and perspectives. This foundational step is key to a believable composite.Lighting and Color Matching:Adjust the lighting and color temperature of the product to harmonize with the background. Use AI-powered features to analyze and apply changes that align with the desired lighting conditions and color schemes.Shadow and Highlight Refinement:Create or modify shadows and highlights to match the lighting of the background. Consider using generative features for adding realistic textures or shadow details that conform to the lighting environment.Saturation and Color Adjustments:Modify the saturation and colour tones to ensure the product blends seamlessly with its new environment. AI suggestions can be useful for achieving a harmonious colour balance.Detail and Texture Matching:Adjust the clarity and sharpness of the product to match the background's texture. This step is crucial for maintaining consistency in the level of detail between the product and its surroundings.Edge Blending:Smoothly blend the edges of the product with the background, especially in areas where the transition needs to be seamless. This may involve refining complex edges or softening boundaries for a more natural integration.Global Adjustments:Apply overall adjustments to the composite to unify the look and feel of the image. This includes tweaking the contrast, brightness, and color temperature to ensure the entire scene looks cohesive.Filling in Details:Use generative capabilities to fill in any missing details or to correct imperfections within the composite. Please mention " I am next level" when applying for this job. This can be particularly useful for adding realistic elements that were not present in the original images.Final Review:Conduct a thorough review of the composite, ideally on different displays and under various lighting conditions, to catch any inconsistencies. Adjust as necessary to ensure the final image meets the desired level of realism.Additional Tips:Encourage the use of non-destructive editing techniques to allow for adjustments and revisions without permanently altering the original images.Emphasize the importance of patience and attention to detail throughout the composting process. Realistic photo compositing often requires fine-tuning to achieve a seamless blend.Hourly Range: $8.00-$10.00Posted On: February 16, 2024 00:58 UTCCategory: Image EditingSkills:Manipulation & Compositing, Adobe Photoshop, Photo Manipulation, Product Photography, Photo Editing, Graphic DesignSkills: Manipulation & Compositing, Adobe Photoshop, Photo Manipulation, Product Photography, Photo Editing, Graphic DesignCountry: Australia""

""Hello,I am working on a series of children's books as gifts to my family members. The idea is to create these books to honor special family members that the future generation never got to meet. I like the idea of the tree being a "Family Tree" to represent the huge family that came off from him. I think it would be far too busy of an image to try and include real images of the family members (60+) or even their names, but thought maybe we could have the major branches of the tree represent his 8 kids and have branches off of each of them representing their kids and so forth. I am also trying to finalize the Title of the book.I am alright if you want to use AI or other tools to help with the creation of the cover.Here is the story from the book to give you more information:Page 1: On January 31, 1931, a boy named Donald Leo Hastings was born in the small town of Alhambra, Illinois. It was a quiet country life for a boy, but Don found ways to fill his days with dreams and adventures.Page 2: His loving mother Jen helped foster a love of reading andstorytelling. The adventures he found in books and stories nurtured a passion for words for the rest of his life. For over 50 years, he spent breakfast completing the daily crossword puzzle.Page 3: The woods, streams, and fields of rural Illinois cultivated a love for being outdoors and a curiosity for the animals he found there. Hiking, fishing, horseback riding, and hunting were his daily pursuits.Page 4: Even when Don wasn’t looking for adventure, it seemed to find him. One sunny day while riding his scooter, Don was stopped by a young girl named Harriet Zoleman. Harriet was visiting her cousin and wasn’t going to miss a chance to ride on Don’s scooter.Page 5: That scooter ride was the start of a 74-year friendship. It was only 3 years after that first meeting, Don and Pat secretly eloped to Arkansas with their two best friends. Don wore his father’s suit and Pat her best Sunday dress.Page 6: Like the wheat and corn fields Don grew up running though, their family grew. First two boys, Donald Jr. and Douglas, just as Don Sr. wanted. Then Pat got her wish for six girls Kathleen, Pamela, Elizabeth, Celeste, Kimberly, and the youngest Jennifer.Page 7: With so many mouths to feed, life wasn't always easy. Don always said, “We didn’t have 2 nickels to rub together but we were as happy as two church mice”, because their home was rich with love and laughter.Page 8: Don worked many hard jobs to care for his family. He found work on a chicken farm, in the local butcher shop, and for the Illinois Central Railroad as a telegrapher and mail clerk.Page 9: Don’s love for the outdoors eventually led him to his dream job as a State of Illinois Game Warden. He patrolled the same woods, streams, and fields he grew up in protecting animals that couldn’t protect themselves.Page 10: Even Don’s family helped with his job often caring for injured animals he brought home. Some even became unusual family pets: raccoons, bear cubs, monkeys, and deer, to name a few.Page 11: When Don retired from Conservation, he had worked his way up to the position of Director overseeing the entire Illinois department and all its officers. He and Pat were ready for their next adventure. They bought a Winnebago and set off to travel the world.Page 12: The incredible wildlife they encountered on their travelsinspired their next journey; creating a magazine for Game Wardens and Conservation. It was called The International Game Warden and is still circulated in over 30 countries today.There are two more pages talking about his love of golf, his passion for telling stories to his family, and about his teachings of living fully and never giving up to his large family.Thank you!Budget: $50Posted On: February 14, 2024 16:39 UTCCategory: IllustrationSkills:Watercolor, Illustration, Book Cover, Drawing, Graphic DesignSkills: Watercolor, Illustration, Book Cover, Drawing, Graphic DesignCountry: United States""
